document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

C743DEED22DD42228B14D9BC66A30068.description:
Begin to understand other Christian
communities and show God’s love for all people through
words and actions.

D0A1396A6DBB4A74916C866F43C469AC.description:
Understand that people express their
belief in God in many different ways.

DDD886BE109C4482B511632D7C24E8D8.description:
Proclaim that God made and loves all
people, and we are called to listen to and respect all people.

43E5DA44C9F34D07953380BE6E7D17FE.description:
CALL TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044,2472]

44B0B7D86BC84138B1D21CA9740329F0.description:
Participate in and reflect on service and
how we can be Jesus for others.

1F865821532A447BB5E815EBDDE71F1A.description:
Understand that we serve God by sharing
our gifts, at whatever age we are in life.

952E443D24414A248B782EA3100A5CE0.description:
Grow in understanding of the special Godgiven
gifts each has to offer the community.

DABF2603280C44549767FCC9AD850698.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
Social Teaching about
the common good
[1905-1948, 2419-2422]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-12

D19BE2FD7AEB431B9EA72AEA8DFB5DB1.description:
Understand that the Church has a mission
given to her by Jesus.

4E66101B12CC4B749DC4790A82075932.description:
Know that through Baptism we are all part
of Jesus’ mission to share the “Good News” of Jesus
Christ.

442DD65057494C1C98560F8891CF40A7.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816-849]
Scripture
Mt. 28: 19-20

033972F6D6524BD698EE7AAB43A79A88.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6 – THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

2C933AD090C14408AE6240099E6C9F5A.description: Understand we honor Mary with special days.

144E700DFBEB4F8AA4A96858F83D7BD3.description:
Identify the Holy Spirit of God at work in the
lives of Mary.

913E5D7B87A94DFDAD8014F9A98E7357.description:
Identify that Mary’s cousins were Elizabeth
and Zechariah who were parents of John the Baptist.

1C29AEC45BD842E8822CD09B1DEB5E31.description:
Recognize some titles of Mary: Mother of
Jesus, Mother of God, Mother of the Church, Our Lady of
Guadalupe and Mary, Our Mother.

B56ED6FC9D044B759DDC60068C2CE605.description:
MARY AS MODEL OF
THE CHURCH
[148-149, 963-975, 2673-
2682]
Scripture
Lk. 1:26-38

E82E99A7BB4641BEA437FFE7A89B24F9.description:
Name and describe the saint they are named
for or another patron saint.

7E49D8BC82514EE582D18E98982896F9.description:
Name the patron saint and the story of the
patron saint of the parish.

D70983FFD479495CA59D3B1BD1B36574.description:
Celebrate days in honor of special saints, e.g.
Saint Patrick, Saint Nicholas.

D2E5C65EC2EB45369AE22890CA22476A.description:
Describe how the saints are holy people and
heroes of the Church.

AF6ABC0F282D4D7CA22539F060DB453D.description:
Name the different vocations: priesthood,
marriage, religious and single life.

A831DB39A5F5460C81337BA9D9EF33AD.description:
Recognize that everyone has a vocation
and that each person’s vocation is lived out in different ways
of life.

F062C811E0974B7EA0C45DE8EA6AE499.description:
Articulate that God created us to know,
love and serve Him by knowing, loving and serving others,
and to live with Him in heaven forever.

97523D244AA448B882E8547D0041DC2E.description:
Explain how we are called to holiness, to be
close to God who is always good and loving.

908069373B474F649EDBAD4BDCF1642D.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014, 2028, 2813]
Scripture
1 Peter 1:15-16
Leviticus 11:44

F39E74CF97204EA1AA8CDCF6F1C2A667.description:
Recognize their parents as faith leaders in
their homes (domestic church).

DB8EFCD7BF254B2397C41B7C74A34E3A.description:
Know that families are also called to pray
together and are a community of faith like their parish, (the
domestic church).

CF08D347A90C42FAB5DEA46225C803FC.description:
Experience how communities work together
to help many people.

8CA792AB7A1D40CEB4D9C826BD3F49A1.description:
Recognize that the Church/our parish as the
community where we come together to worship God and to
learn more about Him and how to serve others.

75A08EF2BF9841B4840168AA50385914.description:
Name and recognize the Pope as the
visible head of the Church on earth.

519AAB68F4D54DDC96E9AB07E4E9B9A5.description:
Identify the Archbishop and recognize his role
as the leader of our Archdiocese, the local Church.

55842BB6B7134410BF8D7BD8771BD2FD.description:
Church Order: The
Hierarchy and
Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

739CFF04F7724F4FAA850A25F27C635C.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE
[871-945]

8295CB6C8155447C9E72AFAAFE33CF2D.description:
Know that Jesus Christ established the
Church and asked the apostles to share Jesus’ story and
God’s love.

A19753CFE9F94344B93A4418F4DCF00A.description:
THE MYSTERY AND
MARKS OF THE
CHURCH: One, Holy,
Catholic, Apostolic
[811-870]

55C6893D87954C209DB552373F26AECB.description:
Know that the Holy Spirit lives in each one of
us and helps us to respect ourselves and others.

D3999D777344447EAFF5722A447D66D9.description:
Temple of the Holy
Spirit [797-801]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19

304C5FB912B244C28DD8E0F6B3D8C5BC.description:
Articulate that Jesus is present with us at
Mass, and we are asked to be the “Body of Christ” as we
pray and serve others.

8AC16553A5C14D7E821A1DC93E8078F1.description:
Share pictures and stories of my Baptism,
when I became part of the family of God.

B4E16FD0AD514EDA85F863209CA542C9.description:
Understand that through Baptism, we
become members of Christians, part of God’s family – the
Church.

41396849312E406B96A0956E55A81ED5.description:
Understand Church is a building, and it is the
people in the building.

1F2B845DEF724E5082D8238A073A122B.description: Find on a map where Jesus lived and grew up.

517336F936044BAB877634C821F105B0.description:
Know that their parish is part of the Church’s
story, our history.

E175A0577A9D44A0BEF44126F1645483.description:
THE CHURCH IN
GOD’S PLAN [748-780]
Church History
[758-780]

5D99846B6D464F079B7716C5BA94F9B2.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5 – EDUCATING FOR THE LIFE, COMMUNITY, AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of
the church, the Body of Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic
church.

5B24EE8D7F82445E8EFB08045F847F74.description: Responses after Lectionary reading and before Gospel

BF2892292B74465F8A026045DC385702.description: Invitation to Liturgy of the Hours

AB426990DD744F039AEEB16516868DFE.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

CB5491CB66734E16B3C2AAF5926DA0C2.description: Verse from Liturgy of the Hours

0E7E79556AFE4C49A6CA49981B93BD12.description: PRAYERS WE KNOW BY HEART, EXPERIENCE AND SHARE AT MASS

28C83DDA1200456E8DFD1D0F1D038890.description:
Experience the stories of the Bible by praying the
Rosary.

45D19745F4934CF4974F28D8C04166D1.description:
Explain the fourteen Stations of the Cross and
how the Stations represent events from Jesus’ suffering and
death.

DFAC16E3B4BF454E9164186828587E87.description:
Participate in various prayer expressions
including the Jesus prayer and choral prayer.

610BAC2AD1CB48769FADCBBC6B59E9A5.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas,
Simbang Gabi, etc.)
[1200-1209,1674-1679,
2683-2696]

F9AE0AC6BC2A4CE5B43661BE84B4ADC5.description:
Read in the New Testament how Jesus prayed
and taught his friends to pray, the perfect prayer, the Lord’s
Prayer.

E490594A0FC14049B70C71D68674F100.description: Recite the Our Father from memory.

FDA029C466B5445D9DDF3373BAA1BD0D.description:
OUR FATHER:
SUMMARY OF THE
GOSPEL
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-14
Lk. 1:28, 42, 11: 1-4

DE9B873A2343407CB51CDF0DDD0ABC45.description:
Experience a variety of expressions of Christian
prayer: e.g., liturgy, silent meditation on Scripture (Lectio
Divina), group recitation, reflection, singing, vocal.

099524D41C54466FA8873F5DEBC262AC.description:
List and show the ways to show reverence and
respect in Church.

0A2ED2B2025B4538AF5B86974008EB65.description:
Exhibit understanding that we can be quietly
aware of God at all times

1AAE11DCD36143BC8DA7F914DDEC0094.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF
PRAYER, PROCESS
Personal, Shared,
Vocal, Singing,
Meditation
2700-2724]

F728DEAA6BAE408EA2E80EA055F68017.description:
Practice asking God, Mary, angels, and the saints
to help others and ourselves during times of need.

4966519A28A348FB9107131D1E55FFF2.description:
Pray in thanksgiving for all the strengths / gifts in
themselves and their classmates.

F878C3905CE54C988D62B68B4911DBA1.description:
Identify and participate in different types of
prayer: praise, thanksgiving, sorrow, and asking.

A4E82EA9E1084BDDBEFEFB6175154444.description:
FORMS OF PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]

3240C5B73F67425B9C95F724DEF0517A.description:
Explain how prayer helps us know God so that
we will choose to love and serve Him.

9693EEB44EC844A1989ED32B7A44EA41.description:
Develop the practice of prayer – talking, listening
and forming a relationship with God.

E215938FC3C74CAC9DB7EE343F6A2853.description:
THE UNIVERSAL CALL
TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

2EEF24FEE7144636BBDABD6B97784637.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

42D8C4513468486FB50868FA97BABE08.description:
Participate and reflect on age appropriate
service stewardship projects calling us to greater
discipleship.

7B96CAD11D624F48B5B99678C5BED09E.description:
Explain what it means to be poor and the
ways we can take care of God’s people.

506BD5A55E2042DFB7F5891A6B5CF3DC.description:
Explain how work in school is an
expression of one of God’s gifts.

232CDFCFA4E44097B51D67CAE8C1E510.description:
Begin to understand that every person
must have a sense of responsibility for all people.

0BCB46F5BD5440F2B9AF1A92913425C7.description:
Demonstrate care of personal belongings,
classroom, school buildings, and parish grounds.

57728E24CBFF4876920FD38DE6DCB1C2.description:
Appreciate creation as a gift from God, and
recognize our responsibility to care this gift.

A7F20402A66F4C66BD0D2379EFE44B63.description:
Catholic Social Teaching –
Consistent Ethic of Life,
Love of Neighbor, and
Corporal and Spiritual
Works of Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

FFABF5CADF054E739F6EC4A019A47416.description:
Recognize our need to be forgiven and
what it means to be forgiven.

8E6ECFB3FFB047548C7E3968B0EBD9B7.description:
Practice apologizing to someone and
forgiving someone (instead of saying, “It’s okay.”).

FFC5DDE2496F45F09D2245839062C818.description:
Articulate how they can express sorrow
for certain actions.

6DBF56AF6C4E4531A4BFCD1EFA734AF8.description: Explain that sin is turning away from God.

E2DE5E9C656C47C18A123AFBF7F38B42.description:
Recognize the difference between sin as a
choice and making a mistake.

09FBECFB5F7B4A58B48FE0D445BC3ACD.description:
Personal and Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25; 3:1-24
Lk. 15: 11-32

7D9F701D0F3544788ABA66C7105CFDA2.description:
Recognize that every person has worth and
God-given rights. (human dignity)

892F95316D034155843CD5870F210D1E.description:
Recall the word virtue as a gift from God
to do good things.

5CDE8EB76FE045B4829E277BDA18005D.description:
Virtues Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture
Micah 6:8
Mt. 5: 1-12

DAE784E71E7048C4BC92FD09590324BB.description:
Identify how the Great Commandment is
the fulfillment of the Ten Commandments.

C9B5E10CC3A9474CA97DDEF5AC0AA752.description:
Recall the story of Exodus, and reflect
what it means to follow and trust God, and the
importance of these rules in our lives.

DF3DF6025BAF4C8DA7C5737B36ED9C15.description:
Covenant and Ten
Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture
Ex.2-24
Ex. 19:16-20:17
Mt. 22:34-40
Mk. 10: 17-20
Lk. 10:25-28

30E68AEAA850484DA4FE827779728976.description:
Explain how Jesus wants them to be kind
to others and to share with others.

E5964B8B4BF24E69B44F7613FC114CB0.description: Distinguish good habits from bad habits.

C64ABE89CB144BCE9D0C1B9493C57D43.description:
Explain the importance for us to be sorry
for our wrongful thoughts and actions.

527C210A0FA146AE91C737707632F327.description:
Distinguish between right and wrong
thoughts and actions; give examples of how our actions
have consequences.

34B248051A804A28808F86CAFB585265.description:
Understand that we make choices (free
will) to love God and others.

DE6945C2B6364BD782883ACE0159D637.description:
Human
Freedom and
Conscience Formation
[1030-1037, 1730-1802]
Scripture
Gen. 6:9-9:17

B25A9B57D97042859383239FD9AC9E5D.description:
Begin to understand that following wise
rules and obeying others with legitimate authority helps
us stay happy, healthy, and holy.

547F1D128A01432B9AE805507BEC9366.description: Made for Happiness with God, Beatitudes [1218-1229, 1716-1717] Scripture 2 Cor. 4:4 Mt. 5: 1-12

EEB67FE50D5E4B9F9DF035051B04E999.description:
Express how we have healthy bodies when
we take care of them.

1EE4094898A043E299E256F371E52628.description:
Show understanding that people are
respected and appreciated for their gifts of culture, race
and language.

41CC3580066C44A6B471B01940FF90F6.description:
Made in the Image of God
– Foundation of Human
Dignity
 [355-368,1004,1700-1876]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3
Col. 1:15

63DA3DBE4A044FA4B214FFCE0CB4528A.description:
Recall that God loves us so much that
human beings are made in God’s image with body and
soul.

9E424385D270477CB98AC097C09ECEF9.description:
Recall that God created us to know, love,
and serve Him and others.

0739D10840844B39AC6E2CD8FAB824DD.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3: MORAL EDUCATION: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled in a
personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.

B72A3A455B574BD78395785BDA34DEF2.description:
Experience blessings as special times
asking for God’s grace, power, and care, and know that
other people can bless us.

18D7E559E1FB4CF2BFCEDAEAD7600F9B.description:
Liturgical Rites: Weddings,
Funerals and Blessings
[1671-1673]

6DF6A50BA5224B04AB857202A8094254.description:
Prayerfully listen to Psalm 100 and
respond “Sing to the Lord, all the world!” after each
verse.

0D0A46F809F447988353B400E17D39AA.description:
Divine Office Liturgy of the
Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalms 117, 150, 100

676FC676682942DD8D487B19482B6F63.description:
Identify and reverentially engage with
sacramentals used by the Church: holy water, crucifix,
candles, blessed medals, and rosary. Altar, cross,
tabernacle, sanctuary light, Paschal Candle, Book of the
Gospels, baptismal font, statues of saints, images of
Mary, holy water fonts, Stations of the Cross, in the
classroom, at church and at home.

502E7ED678CF4BABA413E6C08BEC0F80.description:
Identify symbols of the seasons of the
Liturgical Calendar.

9F7EB310593E46409D63F7256FDEE29B.description:
Recognize the names of other important
days in the Easter Season: Ascension, Pentecost.

457697FDE5A44FF787669ABF7E3E28CB.description:
Recognize that on Feast Days and
Memorials we pray for the living and the dead.

BB91FB4B0C3C4317BBD7994160DEE62C.description:
Identify Holy Week and Easter are the
holiest times of the year.

507298AFAB0C4092B86521335F09FC63.description:
Associate Jesus’ life with the celebration
of important Holy Days in the Church Calendar.

22B77868C78841AA8B8E9F3C24C36C5A.description:
Liturgical Calendar
[1163-1173]
Scripture:
Mk. 16:1-8
Lk. 24: 1-53
Jn . 20:1-10

E5503453C8EF47DBBB313BF63B5AC535.description:
Distinguish between the roles of parents and
parish priests, and how each is called to share God’s
love.

31E2BA43B0174773AF656B694F89A4A2.description:
Identify the two Sacraments at the Service
of Communion: Marriage and Holy Orders.

C72D50D151FD444AA4EAF34680F050C4.description:
Sacraments at the Service
of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:18-24
Mt. 19:4-6; 28:16-20

B676E858F61C4525900A55E4968B1B6A.description:
Identify Reconciliation as a sacrament
where the priest helps us experience God’s saving love
for us. (mercy).

283A26CB30C64977AA7CC2479327F044.description:
Name the two Sacraments of Healing:
Reconciliation and Anointing of the Sick.

B6FA3986A1F04083AA411DE5D377864A.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]
Scripture:
Ps. 32
Mk. 2:1-12

613F6A63A4FC4746A11B6238253616B0.description:
Describe the Sacrament of Eucharist as a
sign of Jesus sharing Himself with us in a special meal
called the Mass.

99F5D38AFE7B4DBF8039045750A72304.description:
Know that we receive the Holy Spirit at
Baptism.

45353CF9794049D5A0993416CF110E28.description:
Describe how when we are baptized we
become Christians, disciples of Jesus Christ. Receiving
this sacrament leads us to Eucharist.

916F9E4E11F2499490115E613387AA64.description:
Identify the Sacraments of Christian
Initiation: Baptism, Eucharist, and Confirmation.

7A22E3DD3708467182DD85A417E5FD53.description:
Know that Christ instituted the Sacraments as
outward signs of grace and gave them to the Church.

843DC2C65CDB4E5799B68B51D4164884.description:
Know that Sacraments are seven ways we
encounter God’s love and grace.

D85EF9BB775540048C31F59871D5BFE3.description:
Describe the time at Mass when the faithful
receive Jesus at Holy Communion.

B4A79A8F02684121BB1EE8A3FBA8B9F3.description:
Identify the consecration as the moment in the
Mass when the priest uses words and actions to make the
bread and wine become the Body and Blood of Christ.

C1845FBE307347B4B161609804C50C0B.description:
Associate the terms sacrificial meal and Lamb
of God with Mass and stories of Jesus’ passion.

0B375610EF2E4D218AB181477EEAAA59.description:
State that we call Jesus Christ the Lamb of God
who takes away sin.

219EF10CBE944D95A7CD1335DBA4DF40.description:
State how we pray the “Our Father” at Mass as
the entire community.

8DB35674B2AB4DBCA3FF5911EE55CEEE.description:
Participate fully in the liturgy by recalling key
responses in the Mass and singing liturgical hymns.

62847AFE94D746CA87EF54B71589670E.description:
Demonstrate reverential gestures during Mass for
presence of Jesus in Eucharist, e.g. bowing, genuflecting.

51AEB473F80944EDA755B6C2BD95844F.description:
Identify the priest as the one who leads the Mass
celebration.

6E8E85B9C4024DD6A5001E578A5C0535.description:
Identify Sunday as the Lord’s Day when we go to
Mass to worship God and thank Him for all his gifts.

A7F8541DDDE645A38F7DD481731ABC6A.description:
Experience Mass as a celebration of God’s love
for us.

EA06A3AAF7B8421689D0B1CCB5E66BDD.description:
EUCHARIST
Who, How, When, and
Where the Mass is
Celebrated
[1135-1167,1322-1419]
Scripture:
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
Jn. 6:32-58
Acts 2:42-47

8354B01C0FE14F428B2D69833CC783C0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

3E92BA67215943C9BEAFC89C5070F2F8.description: Recognize that the Church believes in one God.

ED307EE984C140A385993F367E963041.description:
Identify key phrases in the Apostles’ Creed: the
Father Almighty, Jesus, His only Son, and in the Holy Spirit.

DA425028C75A4B23848194877D2211D5.description:
Understand that the Church helps us know what
to believe as stated in the Creed.

7A5D53FD109843239A985BFFA1CB32AD.description:
THE CREED: A
Statement of Our Belief
[185-1065]

0E2D64D1FAE742048E2A12F43BA1E54F.description:
Identify the Holy Spirit as the helper, guide, one
who dwells within us, and helps us live as Jesus’ disciples.

906B125CB2814F8CA9C4743D1F07279B.description:
State that God the Holy Spirit is the Third Person
of the Trinity.

B03BA2F94DE649ED8BE23E03A1006FDC.description:
Show understanding that Jesus was filled with
God’s Holy Spirit and had a mission to announce the
Good News through teaching and healing.

C57969F108DC4353888580EFFF216329.description: State that Jesus came to save us

870E65DA2F274308AEE61C44386887EA.description:
Identify Jesus, God the Son, as the Second
Person of the Trinity.

76E41CB55C2344DE91E0FCEAF58AAD46.description:
Identify God the Father as the First Person of the
Trinity in the Sign of the Cross.

2E1388AF5F764130AA950533BF49B951.description:
TRINITY:
God the Creator
Jesus the Redeemer,
and Holy Spirit
Sanctifier
[249‐324] Scripture:
Gen. 1:1-31, 2:1-25
Lk 1:26-38; 2:1-20;
2:41-52
Mt. 1:18-2:15; 3:13-1
Mk 14:32-36
Acts 2:1-42

B8E1778638E7448CB33CCF3B92026AB2.description:
Tell about Jesus’ life on earth as a boy, growing
in wisdom, his call to ministry, death and resurrection.

F40AC438F9C544339F972D4E3C4AED22.description:
Recognize that Jesus has the power to heal
others and to raise them from the dead.

DAA9A6768E7D4A2FB226F2C7F9FE74FE.description:
Know that Christmas is when Jesus was born to
Mary in Bethlehem.

C63AFE73CAC746068AC9D041F13EFDBE.description:
Deepen understanding that Jesus was both fully
God and fully human.

720047701FFC43369DB762E46E227F77.description:
Name and locate the four Gospels in the New
Testament that tell the stories of Jesus.

EDC946913F604D8789DA8862E20057A8.description:
Retell a grade level Old Testament story and
one New Testament parable and the lesson to be learned.
(Resource: Grade Level Scripture Recommendations)

C40BFF410059498BAA3E328047346266.description:
Salvation History
[50‐73]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

F50C50C500474351AF08B6F6E81E1845.description:
Identify the two main parts of the Bible: Old
Testament (prepare us for Jesus) and the New Testament
(about Jesus and the Church.).

DFF8266625B841CF9FE283DBE45F882C.description:
Recall that the Bible is the sacred book that
reveals God’s love for us.

7B854C28611547059240F53D9534EDBC.description:
Sacred Scripture
[101‐141]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

B4DF553E618B43AFA4DB1B0B5D2DD438.description:
Recall the role of angels as God’s messengers
and that we each have a Guardian Angel who watches
over and protects us.

3643528A92C24F20B743DD6E240CD88A.description:
Identify signs of death and new life in creation and
associate with Jesus’ death and resurrection.

7A07BEB7D69E44B2BEAEEF955EBA430F.description:
Retell creation stories from the Bible showing God
as the Creator of all things (including us, who are made in
His image and likeness) and he trusts us to use and take
care of these gifts.

B5B4AD85F915458CBD47B89E5184E148.description: State that God reveals Himself in all of creation.

E355839F8A2445AF855752C49BF1DD2C.description: Know that creation is a sign of God’s love for us.

71AD5EED4C874895A91E9D392F11BDB0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1: KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students will explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
